intro: Spartocytisus albus, commonly known as the white broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rocky or coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a landscape plant.
